title: Teenage girl killed herself after complaining she had been "betrayed" by Childline
text:
A schoolgirl killed herself after complaining she had been "betrayed" by Childline, an inquest heard.

Jesse Walker, 16, had claimed that the charity had leaked confidential details about her suicidal thoughts to the police.

The teenage girl, described as a “beautiful soul”, had contacted the counselling charity via a live chat service while alone in her bedroom confessing that she was having thoughts about harming herself.

The ChildLine operator knew only that the teen was called Jesse and the family home was in the seaside town of Scarborough, North Yorkshire.

However after Jesse cut short the conversation ChildLine was so concerned for her welfare that they contacted the National Crime Agency, asking them to trace the IP address of her computer.

When a Pc James Dunn, of North Yorkshire Police, arrived at her home at 1.30am he was told by Jesse’s mother that her daughter was asleep in bed.
description: A schoolgirl killed herself after complaining she had been "betrayed" by Childline, an inquest heard.
